p: The mass cultivation of microalgae has been evaluated for the production of sustainable biomass for food, feed, chemicals, biofuel, and high-value products [ 112]. Currently, there are two primary types of mass-cultivation systems: (i) Photobioreactors (PBRs), and (ii) raceway ponds. Closed PBRs offer better control over contamination and physiochemical conditions [ 55]. Although, the capital, operational, and energetic costs remain significantly higher than open raceway ponds, which are much less complex and require a lower capital investment [ 113]
